text: that is not what you do with science
there are people walking among us who
are cherry-picking science for whatever
is their cultural political religious
economic philosophies Abraham Lincoln
understood this emergent value of
science and governance and in 1863
arguably like the bloodiest year of the
bloodiest war we have ever fought the
same year of his Gettysburg Address that
year he founded the national academy of
sciences an organization independent of
government but task by government to
advise them on all the ways emerging
science would and should matter in their
formation of legislation so when I see
people cherry-picking science it is an
abomination of that mission statement
that got put into place 150 years ago if
we go forward allowing people in charge
to cherry-pick science that is not an
informed democracy we should fear the
future of our nation in all the ways
that science matters to that future we
should fear our health our wealth and
our security if that's how people are
making decision
